title: Sydney Fish Market’s ‘last hurrah’ before move to new home
description: Doors have opened on the final Christmas seafood marathon at Sydney Fish Market's original location, before it moves to its new home.  Sydney Fish Market Chief Executive Daniel Jarosch joined Sky News Australia to discuss the “last hurrah”.  “We’ve got a great crowd here already.”

title: President announces new ‘Trump-class’ battleships for navy’s ‘Golden Fleet’
description: United States President Donald Trump says the US is in “desperate need” of new naval ships as he announces the construction of two brand new battleships.  “I have approved a plan for the navy to begin the construction of two brand new … battleships,” Mr Trump said.   “They will have one hundred times the … force, the power, and there’s never been anything like these ships.”

title: Review finds southeast Queensland missed critical Cyclone Alfred warnings
description: It has been revealed locals in southeast Queensland missed critical warnings about Cyclone Alfred earlier this year.  A report into the state's response to the weather event found the loss of power to more than 500,000 properties affected the ability for people to contact triple zero.  The Emergency Management Inspector-General is advising Queensland to develop better offline telecommunications in case another weather event on the same scale occurs.  Findings also showed challenges in staffing and operational readiness.

title: ‘Failures in government need to be investigated’: Calls grow for Bondi attack Royal Commission
description: Nationals Senator Matt Canavan discusses the need for a Royal Commission into the Bondi Beach terror attack.   “It’s a very reasonable request, particularly those from the Jewish community who have suffered so much, to have a Royal Commission,” Mr Canavan said.  “Any failures in government need to be investigated.”

title: ‘We’ve got to defeat antisemitism’: Coalition create draft Royal Commission into Bondi massacre
description: Shadow Attorney-General Andrew Wallace discusses the Coalition’s draft terms of reference for a Royal Commission into the Bondi Beach terror attack.   “The Coalition over the weekend drafted, as part of its taskforce, the draft terms of reference for a federal Royal Commission,” Mr Wallace said.   “We need to get this right; we need a thorough and fundamental examination of what went on here.”

title: Adelaide police criticised after review finds 40 per cent of officers not deployable
description: Adelaide's police force is under fire for having too many officers sitting at their desks who are unavailable to respond to frontline incidents.  An independent review has found that up to 40 per cent of the city's officers were not deployable due to increased lack of training and increased administrative work.  The state's police commissioner has announced changes, including reduced reporting and enhanced training.

title: ‘Hatred not taken seriously’: Woman breaks down in address to Jewish and Muslim leaders
description: New South Wales Doctor Miriam Levy addresses both Jewish and Muslim leaders who have united at Liverpool Hospital for a lighting of the Menorah candles.  “Bondi showed us what happens when hatred is not taken seriously,” Ms Levy said.   “The government needs to do more to investigate how it has been manifested so brutally.”

title: Jacinta Allan promises new protest laws following Bondi’s terrorist attack
description: Victoria Premier Jacinta Allan has pledged new police powers to stop protests in the wake of the horrific Bondi terrorist attack.  The announcement aims to crack down on hate speech and tighten gun ownership laws, as well as make it easier to prosecute people who incite hatred.  She says it would allow the chief commissioner to end and move along the protests.

title: ‘Needs to change’: Albanese says Bondi attack shows Australia must reduce guns on the streets
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese discusses Labor’s push for reforms to gun laws in Australia.   “The terrible events at Bondi show that we do need more guns off our streets,” Mr Albanese said.   “The fact there are more guns in Australia today than there were at the time of the Port Arthur massacre is of real concern to Australians.  “It needs to change.”

title: ‘I do regret the politicisation of this issue’: Albanese on response to Bondi terror attack
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese expresses his “regret” over the politicisation of the Bondi Beach terror attack.  “I certainly do regret the politicisation of this issue; this is a time where the nation needs to come together in unity and with that sense of purpose," Mr Albanese said.   “This is not a time for people to look for political product differentiation, for the sake of it, and I’ll continue to argue for unity.   “I’ll continue to conduct myself in a way that’s consistent with that call for national unity.”

title: Four men rescued after boat capsizes near Perth
description: Four men have been rescued from the water after a wave caused their boat to capsize off Perth.  The vessel was on its way back from Rottnest Island when the incident unfolded.  The group spent 45 minutes in the water before being brought to safety by a Rottnest ferry skipper.   Paramedics checked over the men, who are understood to be in good condition.

title: Nicki Minaj's instant regret after calling JD Vance 'assassin' to Erika Kirk
description: Nicki Minaj caused a stir at AmericaFest after referring to US Vice President JD Vance as an “assassin” during an on-stage appearance with Erika Kirk.  Erika Kirk is the widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, who was assassinated in September during an outdoor Turning Point USA event in Utah.  Minaj was a surprise guest at the Turning Point USA conference, founded by Kirk to mobilise young conservative voters.  Asked about her message to young men, Minaj praised President Donald Trump and JD Vance as “amazing role models”.  She called Trump “our handsome, dashing president” before stumbling over her words and stopping herself mid-sentence as she referred to Vance as an "assassin".  "Dear young men, you have amazing role models like our handsome, dashing president. And you have amazing role models like the assassin JD Vance, our vice president," the rapper said before catching herself.  The remark prompted laughter from Erika Kirk, who quickly brushed it off and reassured Minaj.  "Trust me, there's nothing new under the sun that I have not heard, so you're fine," Kirk said.  Minaj smiled and leant forward as the moment passed, and the conversation moved on.

title: Albanese accused of being ‘very slippery’ as he dodges Royal Commission
description: The Australian's Foreign Editor Greg Sheridan discusses the Labor government dodging a Royal Commission into the Bondi Beach terror attack.   “(Anthony Albanese) is being very slippery about the state Royal Commission,” Mr Sheridan told Sky News Australia.   “The bigger need is for a Royal Commission into antisemitism.   “The unwillingness to do that, I think, is because so much contemporary antisemitism comes from the left of Australian politics, and he would be embarrassed.”

title: Trump’s new battleships built with ‘high-powered lasers’ to wipe targets out
description: US President Donald Trump announces the development of “high-powered lasers” being built into brand new battleships, alongside guns and missiles at the “highest level”.  “We have lasers where you aim the lasers at a target, and it just wipes it out,” Mr Trump said.  “They'll be the most sophisticated lasers in the world.” ​

title: Trump blasts reporter for using Epstein files to deflect Republicans' ‘tremendous success’
description: US President Donald Trump says the Epstein files are being used to “deflect” from the “tremendous success” of the Republican Party.  “Today, we're building the biggest ships in the world, and they're asking me questions about Jeffrey Epstein,” Mr Trump said.  “A lot of Republicans are angry.”
